pageContext.claim: “We secured nearly $1.2 billion to expand rural broadband, which you need very badly.”
pageContext.analysis: It’s not clear exactly where Trump got this number. The farm bill passed in Dec. 2018 included $600 million in funding for high-speed rural broadband. There was discussion of including broadband in the president’s stalled infrastructure plan and a number of proposals have been introduced, but not passed in Congress. In April 2019, the Trump administration and the Federal Communications Commission proposed to invest $20.4 billion in broadband over 10 years.
